result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid in full within term of supervision.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

No contact with William Foltz.

No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bar, tavern or casino.
Restitution, court costs and attorney fees to be taken from 25% of all prison wages and accounts.

records.addlTxt: #1 - Employment verification; #2 - Statement from Joe Draeger

Defendant Andrew D Schroeder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Defendant Andrew D Schroeder in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:01 PM. State - Here for change of plea and sentencing. Recites offer. Count 1 - G plea, has complied with victim witness notification and provided court with victim impact statement, joint recommendation of 3 years probation, court costs, conditional time 270 days in FC jail (defense free to argue on jail time) AODA and follow through with any recommendations, restitution in the amount of $4000 plus victim witness surcharge of $400 totaling $4400 to be paid within term of probation - no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars, taverns or casinos, FT emp/schooling, 100 hours community service, no contact with William Foltz. Finlan and Schroeder agree. Schroeder pleads guilty as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire. Off record to allow Finlan to properly fill out form, 2:05 PM. Back on the record 2:06 PM. Court goes over form with the defendant and finds he is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty to count 1. State makes final statement, victim has questioned whether or not the court is able to consider a tax intercept and possibly making it as a condition of probation to file federal/state taxes and any refund be ordered to be paid towards restitution, 58 days jail credit and asks for 270 days in FC jail. Court questions state on prior record and informs Finlan that he is not required to follow joint recommendation, offers to allow to discuss with his client, off record 2:21 PM. Back on the record, 2:26. Finlan makes final statement, 67 days jail credit for stated reasons on the record, Finlan offers 2 exhibits (1 - Letter from Schroeder's Auto Sale indicating has job waiting for him & #2 - Draeger Oil), no objection to intercept tax refunds and agrees with all conditions of probation except asking for no jail time and impose maximum amount of probation of 3 years, if ordered jail asks for imposed and stayed, if jail ordered asks that time be served in another county, asks for 30 days to report for stated reasons. Schroeder makes statement, remorseful. Court questions if victim would like to make statement, State indicates victim would like to State to speak on behalf of him. Court considers all statements and information provided in court and rejects joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Count 1 - imposes 2.5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system consisting of 1 year of incarceration and 1.5 years of extended supervision. Conditions: No consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars, taverns or casinos, FT employment/schooling, no contact with William Foltz, restitution in the amount of $4000 plus victim witness surcharge of $400 to be paid within term of extended supervision, court costs, attorney fees to be paid through probation as well, credit for 67 days. Prison wages and accounts to be applied to costs and restitution and attorney fees. DNA sample required with expunction rights given. Appeal, voting and firearm rights given. Finlan questions amount of prison wages taken. Court believes only 25% of wages can be taken. Schroeder makes statement, court responds. Court makes him eligible for any programs he may be eligible for.
for plea/sentencing date on same date as JT @ 9 am - approved by court
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 16, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on February 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew D Schroeder appears via video from FC jail, with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan appearing by telephone. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:17 AM. Finlan filed motion to reduce bond and makes statement regarding his motion, asks to be set as signature bond. State objects to the motion and asks that Forest County have priority access to defendant. Court imposes $5000 cash bond at this point for stated reasons.  Jury trial scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant on January 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Return on warrant on January 4, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:19 PM. State - defendant is currently incarcerated in the Cook County Illinois Jail - trying to see if the defendant will waive extradition to WI and will either prepare for extradition or for transport. Finlan responds. Court continues warrant on this matter and will set for further proceedings once incarcerated.
per DA's office; they can't do a writ.  Defendant is in the Cook County Correctional Institution.
Final pre-trial on April 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Per DA's office - they will do a writ for his appearance/lmc

Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:19 PM. State - believes the defendant is incarcerted in Cook County, Illinois, requests a warrant, nationwide if possible, body only. Court issues bench warrant, nationwide, body or $5000.00

Defendant Andrew D Schroeder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan - both appear telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:46 PM. State believes that the PH will be waived and that is why the parties have been allowed to appear telephonically and State will be filing an Information that mirrors the complaint. Schroeder and Finlan agree. Court does verbal waiver of PH collaquey, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Court has Information that mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pelas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT, parties instructed that they would need to be in person.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew D Schroeder in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:55 AM. Finlan has not had a chance to talk to the defendant. Court instructs Finlan that it has previously read the complaint to the defendant. Finlan waives additional reading of the complaint, requests PH, has not talked to client about waiving time limits but highly recommends it. Schroeder willing to waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Attorney Nicholas Cirilli is unable to represent Mr. Schroeder.  Shawn Behrens contacted.  Waiting for reply.
Attorney Nicholas Cirilli has been appointed to this case, however per Cirilli's office will not be sworn into bar until tomorrow. Will call with attorney #.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew D Schroeder in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:22 AM. Schroeder given complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney. Schroeder understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, would like a court appointed attorney and states he does not qualify for SPD. Recess to fill out paperwork. State - bond - $2000.00 signature bond, no contact with William Foltz. Recalled at 9:44 AM with same appearances. Court has court appointed attorney paperwork, goes thru it, will appoint counsel at $200.00/month with first payment due in 10 days. Schroeder states he can only afford to pay $50.00/month. Court - $100.00/month with first payment due 10/15/15. Court sets for AIA on 9/30/15 at 9:45 AM. Take court appointed form to JA and let her know when the hearing is.
